channel.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
channel.description:
I have installed JAVA on: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java Java installed perfectly. But when I open compiler.bat file I get a error. It calls like whis:
You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
Who I do wrong? Did anyone have a solution?

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

No in my code, the cd …/bin locates where the bulby file is… so idk.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @king_gauge king gauge
item.description:
@king_gauge wrote:

Ugh, again, he isnt using a 508…
try this:

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

Try this:

@echo off title Fathienblade 508 v.3 Compiler cd ../bin echo Compiling all files.... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @Grums Grums
item.description:
@Grums wrote:

Maybe when a do what fing with variables I need rebot me comp?

When i write in mine compiler this code:

@echo off Title Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java pause

I have an error like whis:

javac: file not found: .\Bulby\.\io\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
It’s something like javac.exe, but in mine folder javac.exe doesin’t exist really.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“deery50, post:5, topic:343235”]I had the same probem! here replace everything in the compiler with this:

[code]@echo off
Title Compiler
cd …
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java
pause

[/code][/quote]he’s not using some shit 508.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @OmgWaffles OmgWaffles
item.description:
@OmgWaffles wrote:

you need to download jdk, and once you have you go to control panel, search environment variables and then you edit and you add 2 codes, one to the top box and one to the bottom, they should look like this:
Variable name: CLASSPATH
Variable value:C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin
in bottom box this next one will look like this,
Variable name: PATH
Variable value: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin

if you dont have path or classpath just click new and make em, im on windows 7 as well and i just got mine to work last night and it was because of those codes

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @deery50 deery50
item.description:
@deery50 wrote:

I had the same probem! here replace everything in the compiler with this:

[code]@echo off
Title Compiler
cd …
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java
pause

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with java (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @Grums Grums
item.description:
@Grums wrote:

Below is compiler.bat code:

@echo off @TITLE Reality's Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

About variables is one thing, in Windows 7 is only “Path” variable. Did I need to edit only “Path” variable? Or I need to create new one “classpath” variable? I mean, need to edit “Path” variable and create new one named like “classpath” ? Or just edit “Path” variable and done?

Read full topic
